are_ids_in_same_cluster(id_1, id_2)[source]¶

Return True if both nodes ids are in this cluster (by ids) # TODO : make test ! :param id_1: first id :param id_2: second id :return: True if both ids are in the same cluster, false otherwise

are_names_in_same_cluster(name_1: str, name_2: str) → bool[source]¶

Return True if both nodes id are in this cluster (by name). Translate names to id and fallback to check if ids in same cluster # TODO : make test ! :param name_1: first name :param name_2: second name :return: True if both names are in the same cluster, false otherwise

copy_ids_to_image()[source]¶

Copy “id” values of nodes to their “image” field (useful if we have no image, and id are actual path) :return: Nothing (+ change the internal state)

Returns a list of edges as a dict in the order (node_id => has edge to => cluster_id) :return:

Load/ Import a graph from a dict :param tmp_input: A Dict version of the graph to import :return: The graph as an object

replace_id_from_mapping(filename_to_id: Dict) → Dict[source]¶

Replace olds id by new ids, if provided in the input list (filename_to_id). Ex : {“toto”:id=2} input with {Edge : {“toto”:id=1}} input => {Edge : {“toto”:id=2}} output :param filename_to_id: a mapping from name to ids :return: a mapping from old id to new ids (Ex : {2:1} in previus example) + change state of the graph

common.Graph.graph_datastructure.load_visjs_to_graph(visjs_json_path: pathlib.Path = None) → common.Graph.graph_datastructure.GraphDataStruct[source]¶

Load VisJS to graph datastructure :param visjs_json_path: path to the visjs graph storage :return: The graph datastructure as an object

common.Graph.graph_datastructure.merge_edges_with_colors(vis_edges: Dict, db_edges: Dict) → List[common.Graph.edge.Edge][source]¶

Merge a edges of two graphs with colors depending on good/bad matches :param vis_edges: The first edges set to merge (ground truth one) :param db_edges: The second edges set to merge (extracted from server) :return: A list of edges with colors

common.Graph.graph_datastructure.merge_graphs(visjs_graph: common.Graph.graph_datastructure.GraphDataStruct, db_graph: common.Graph.graph_datastructure.GraphDataStruct, cluster_mapping: List[common.PerformanceDatastructs.clustermatch_datastruct.ClusterMatch]) → Dict[source]¶

Merge two graphs into one unique graph. Uses the list of clusters matches to merge each cluster with each other. Merge a visjs and db graph to produce only one visjs graph, with colors depending on good/bad matches :param visjs_graph: The first graph to merge (ground truth one) :param db_graph: The second graph to merge (extracted from server) :param cluster_mapping: The list of clusterMatch that say “This cluster is the same as this one” for the merge. :return: A datastructure (json style/ dict style) that displays all data
